f3 package¶

Submodules¶

f3.files module¶

f3.photometry module¶

class f3.photometry.star(kic, ffi_dir=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Routines to perform photometry on the Kepler full frame images

Ben Montet, 2017 https://github.com/benmontet/f3 See repository for a tutorial

adjust_aperture(image_region=15, ignore_bright=0)[source]¶

Develop a panel showing the current aperture and the light curve as judged from that aperture. Clicking on individual pixels on the aperture will toggle those pixels on or off into the aperture (which will be updated after closing the plot). Clicking on the 0th row or column will turn off all pixels in that column or row, respectively. Will iterate continuously until the figure is closed without updating any pixels.

calc_centroids()[source]¶

Identify the centroid positions for the target star at all epochs

calc_fluxes(min_flux=5000, outlier_iterations=5, max_outlier_obs=4, outlier_limit=1.7)[source]¶

Determine the suitable reference stars, and then the total flux in those stars and in the target star in each epoch

data_for_target(do_roll=True)[source]¶

Determine the normalized photometry, accounting for effects shared by reference stars

define_spotsignal()[source]¶

Identify the “expected” flux value at the time of each observation based on the Kepler long-cadence data.

do_photometry()[source]¶

Actually calculate photometry

do_rolltest(g, wh)[source]¶

Test for shifts in particular orientations by differential velocity aberrations. Allow for the possibility that the aperture could be shifted by up to one pixel as judged by the observed scatter

find_other_sources(plot_flag=False, edge_lim=0.015, min_val=5000, ntargets=250, extend_region_size=3, remove_excess=4, plot_window=15)[source]¶

Identify apertures for all sources on the postcard, both for the target and potential reference stars

generate_panel(img)[source]¶

Create the figure viewed in adjust_aperture

make_postcard(npix=300, shape=(1070, 1132), buffer_size=15)[source]¶

Develop a “postcard” region, npix by npix in size, around the target star. Other stars in this postcard will be used as possible reference stars.

mini_lc(s1, s2, g, wh, factr)[source]¶
